New Records: Spain won every group game on the way to the title, matching their feat of 2008
Key Match Events: Ferran Torres scored a clinically taken 13th-minute goal
Dani Olmo split the Albanian defence with a slide-rule pass
David Raya made a decent save to keep out a well-struck shot by Kristjan Asllani
Joselu showed great agility to hook a volley over the bar from Alejandro Grimaldo's cross
Armando Broja tried to lift a shot over Raya but the keeper stuck out his left arm to claw it away
Pre-Game Insights: Spain coach Luis de la Fuente made 10 changes to the side that began the victory over reigning champions Italy
Albania's fans created a fever pitch atmosphere as kickoff approached
Post-Match Reflections: Spain topped the group with nine points with Italy second on four after they snatched a last-gasp 1-1 draw with Croatia
Albania finished bottom of the group with one point
Albania's defeat also had an impact elsewhere, meaning France, Netherlands and England progressed to the next round before their final group matches
Miscellaneous Highlights: The fog of Albania's red flares was still hanging over the pitch when Spain produced a vivid reminder of the depth in their squad
Spain controlled the tempo of the opening period to such an extent that Albania were unable to give their fans anything to feed off
Others: The match was played at the Merkur Spiel-Arena in DÃ¼sseldorf, Germany, in front of 46,586 spectators
